basic_info_list: SWE intern@Trailytics| ex-Machine Learning intern@IIT Kharagpur| ex-DS intern@LGM, The Sparks Foundation| OpenSource Mentor@OpenCode|ex-DSA intern@TwoWaits|GSSoC'22|ex-intern@Delloite
Projects: VAE Siamese fusion of Satellite imagery
Associated with Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur

This Adaptive Traffic Signal Timer reduces traffic congestion on highways, provides faster travel for people, and consumes less fuel by utilising live pictures from the cameras at traffic intersections to calculate traffic density using YOLO object identification and setting the signal timers appropriately
Experience: Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur · Internship

1)Currently I am pursuing my summer research internship under professor Rintu Kumar Gayen through SRFP 2022. My topic of research is Variational AutoEncoder Siamese Network for fusion on Satellite Imagery. 
2)My project idea was to have two satellite images (i.e- C_image & L_image) and to produce Fusion of them using Variational AutoEncoder and Siamese Network.
First train the VAE using several similar images, and produce the decoded image after encoding process of individual C_image and L_Image and store the result as VAE_c ,VAE_l. Then pass the images through VGG16/VGG19 and get the desired result like VGG_c and VGG_l. 
Next we concatenate both the result like:
VGG_VAE_c= VGG_c+VAE_C (USING PYTORCH)
VGG_VAE_l= VGG_l+VAE_l(USING PYTORCH)
Then put both these images into Siamese_concet code and get the desired result. 
3) Also researching on publishing the Research paper and journal on the same. Thankyou to our project lead- Mr. Tamesh Halder, PhD Research Scholar of IIT KGP for assisting me in everything .
Volunteering:
Developed NLP model for Abstractive Text Summarization.
From ovrnight working , gaining knowledge to sharing food and having fun it was a wonderful experience.
